intro: Polylepis albicans, commonly known as the white polylepis, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive white bark and dense, evergreen foliage. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Polylepis albicans plays a crucial role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various endemic species. Its ecological importance has led to conservation efforts aimed at protecting this unique botanical species.
